events.title: Quoting religious text could be defence against Australia‚Äôs new hate speech laws, draft bill shows
events.description: Referencing ‚Äòteaching or discussion‚Äô could give exemption from legislation Labor hopes to pass next week Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast People accused of breaching the Albanese government‚Äôs new hate speech laws could argue their conduct was legal because they were quoting from a religious text, draft legislation shows. Extracts of the draft bill obtained by Guardian Australia show it will be illegal to publicly promote or incite hatred, or disseminate ideas of superiority or hatred towards of another person or group of people based on their race, colour, or national or ethnic origin. But within the draft bill is a proposed legal defence to the rule that states the legislation does not apply to an individual directly quoting a religious text. ‚Äú[The offence] not apply to conduct that consists only of directly quoting from, or otherwise referencing, a religious text for the purpose of religious teaching or discussion,‚Äù the draft states. The government promised to tackle antisemitism, crack down on so-called ‚Äúhate preachers‚Äù and hate speech following the alleged Bondi terror attack in December. The prime minister, Anthony Albanese, is expected to have more to say about the plans early on Tuesday morning. Albanese on Monday confirmed parliament would sit for two days on 19 and 20 January to rush through the new laws. Parliament had been due to return for the year on 3 February. The sitting will include condolence motions for the 15 people killed at Bondi last month. The new laws will create serious offences for hate preachers, increase penalties for hate crimes, create a new racial vilification offence, introduce a new listing for prohibited hate groups, at a lower threshold than the terror group listing, as well as introduce provisions to establish the biggest gun buyback program since the Port Arthur massacre. The legislation will also ensure offenders driven by extremism will have that motivation factored into their sentencing, strengthen existing bans on prohibited symbols, and create a new offence for inciting hatred in order to intimidate or harass. The home affairs minister will have new powers to cancel or refuse visas. Crossbenchers are due to be briefed on the legislation on Tuesday. Some privately expressed concerns the major parties would use the secretive intelligence and security committee to limit genuine consultation on the plan. Labor and the Coalition shut out crossbench and independent members from serving on the committee. The attorney general, Michelle Rowland, said the laws would be ‚Äúthe toughest hate laws Australia has ever seen‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: Sudan: After 1,000 days of war, millions of civilians still bearing brunt
events.description: Aid agencies marked 1,000 days of war in Sudan on Friday with a grim reminder that the conflict has created the world‚Äôs biggest hunger crisis and largest displacement emergency. Every day, civilians have been ‚Äúpaying the price for a war they did not choose‚Äù, said UN aid coordination office, OCHA.

events.title: Trump‚Äôs other Latin American feud: why Colombia‚Äôs Petro is not Maduro
events.description: Leftwing leader rallies his supporters as US president accuses him of drug trafficking and threatens military action A leftwing South American firebrand calls for his followers to rally in public squares nationwide to defend his country‚Äôs sovereignty and decry verbal attacks from Donald Trump. The US president accuses the leader of personally flooding American streets with illegal drugs and imposes sanctions against him and his wife. Threats of military action are followed by a phone conversation between the two leaders. One might imagine that this is a description of the buildup of tensions that led to the 3 January special forces raid on Caracas to capture the Venezuelan leader, Nicol√°s Maduro, and his wife, Cilia Flores, to face several criminal charges in New York. Continue reading...

events.title: Haiti faces humanitarian, healthcare strain as gang violence disrupts NGO operations
events.description: Sixteen years since the devastating earthquake in Haiti that killed more than 200,000 people and flattened countless homes and infrastructure, disaster has given way to other crises. Today, gang violence continues to plague the Caribbean nation, displacing at least 1.4 million people in 2025 according to the UN. Civilians also have trouble accessing healthcare, as Claire Ha Duong, deputy programme manager at Doctors Without Borders tells FRANCE 24.

events.title: Anthony Joshua‚Äôs driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua‚Äôs driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and ‚Äúdriving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property‚Äù. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Bride and groom among 8 killed in gas cylinder blast at wedding in Pakistan
events.description: A gas cylinder explosion hours after a wedding reception in Pakistan's capital has killed at least eight people, including the bride and groom, and injured seven others

events.title: Iran: UN human rights chief ‚Äòdeeply disturbed‚Äô by protest-related violence
events.description: The UN human rights chief has called for an independent and transparent investigation into reports of deaths and widespread arrests during ongoing nationwide protests in Iran, amid mounting concerns over the use of force by security forces.

events.title: Iran: Families search for loved ones among body bags
events.description: Warning: Graphic images. üáÆüá∑ Videos appearing on social media and verified by France 24 @TheObservers team in Paris showed dozens of bodies accumulating at a morgue in Kahrizak, south of Tehran, with families searching to identify their loved ones and groups saying they were victims of the Iranian authorities' crackdown on protests. In their 16th day, demonstrations began when traders in the Iranian capital took to the streets over a sudden depreciation of the national currency. They have since spread nationwide, with demonstrators calling for the fall of the Iranian regime, prompting a heavy-handed response from the authorities.

events.title: Armed Iranian protesters battle police in Tehran streets as Trump warns of forceful US response
events.description: Protests in Iran turn more violent with 65 reportedly killed by Friday and over 2,300 arrested as authorities imposed an internet blackout amid nationwide anti-regime unrest.

events.title: After Venezuela, is the world order shifting from diplomacy towards aggression?
events.description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks with Peter Krause of Boston College about the Trump Administration's willingness to act unilaterally against other countries and what this means for international relations.

events.title: Global economy shows signs of steady but subdued growth
events.description: The global economy has shown resilience amid turbulence during the past year, including shifting trade policies ‚Äì yet growth remains subdued and far below pre-pandemic levels, the UN said in a landmark report published on Thursday.

events.title: Two weeks on, questions linger over targeting and impact of US airstrikes in Nigeria
events.description: Very little information has been shared about strikes in Sokoto state Two weeks after the US carried out Christmas Day airstrikes in north-west Nigeria on what it described as Islamic State fighters, questions remain over the specific group that was targeted and the operation‚Äôs impact. In the aftermath of the strikes, Donald Trump said in a post on his Truth Social platform that ‚ÄúISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria , who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians‚Äù were hit with ‚Äúnumerous perfect strikes‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: There is a 'range of options' for US intervention in Iran as tension grows
events.description: Iran's foreign minister said on Monday the Islamic republic is ready for both war and talks after repeated threats from US President Donald Trump to intervene militarily over a crackdown on protests that activists fear has killed hundreds. Trump has also said he would ask Elon Musk to send more Starlink satellite terminals to give protesters Internet access as the country undergoes an Internet shutdown. FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani looks at what the US could actually do.

events.title: Deadly avalanche claims 2 snowmobilers in Washington state backcountry, 2 rescued
events.description: Two snowmobilers were killed in an avalanche near Longs Pass in Washington's Okanogan-Wenatchee National Forest. Two survivors were rescued after a distress call.

events.title: Iran flips ‚Äòkill switch‚Äô to hide alleged crimes as death toll rises amid protests
events.description: Iran protests spread to 180 cities as authorities allegedly use lethal force against demonstrators, with human rights activists in Iran reporting 65 killed and 2,300 arrested.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US affairs in Latin America
events.description: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the United States in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: Ban on ‚Äòglobalise the intifada‚Äô risks importing ‚Äòrepressive models‚Äô from UK, NSW inquiry after Bondi attack told
events.description: Australian National Imams Council say criminalising slogan will unduly impact Muslim Australians including Palestinian and Arab communities Banning phrases such as ‚Äúglobalise the intifada‚Äù is ‚Äúlikely to disproportionately affect Muslim Australians, including Palestinian and Arab communities,‚Äù a New South Wales parliamentary inquiry has been told. The submission by the Australian National Imams Council [Anic] has been echoed by activist group the Palestine Action Group [PAG], who said a ban on the chant risks ‚Äúimporting repressive models from overseas, particularly the United Kingdom‚Äù, where police have announced they will arrest protesters who use the phrase. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump says Iran wants to negotiate as the death toll in protests rises to at least 544
events.description: President Donald Trump says Iran wants to negotiate with the U.S. after his threat to strike the country over its crackdown on protesters

events.title: Iran warns US troops and Israel will be targets if America strikes over protests
events.description: President Donald Trump says Iran reached out to the U.S. and proposed negotiations after he threatened action in response to a crackdown on protesters in the Middle Eastern country

events.title: Iran warns U.S. and Israel against military actions after deadly protests crackdown
events.description: Iran warned the U.S. and Israel against military action as activists said at least 203 people have been killed in the nationwide protests, a toll they say is likely far higher.

events.title: Iran rejects Trump bomb threats after protest deaths
events.description: Violent protests and a fierce security crackdown have killed hundreds of people in Iran.

events.title: Carney heads to Beijing as Trump‚Äôs America First agenda forces Canada into trade rethink
events.description: Canada‚Äôs PM seeks to smooth over past ructions in relationship with China as trade war takes its toll During the final stretch of Canada‚Äôs spring election campaign, Mark Carney told a debate audience that China was the country‚Äôs ‚Äúbiggest geopolitical risk‚Äù. He pointed to its attempts to meddle in elections and its recent efforts to disrupt Canada‚Äôs Arctic claims. When Carney‚Äôs government plane touches down in Beijing this week, it will be the first time a Canadian prime minister has been welcomed in nearly a decade. The trip, undertaken amid the rupturing of global economic and political alliances , reflects a desire by Ottawa to mend a broken relationship with a global superpower that uses its vast and lucrative market to both woo and punish countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump threatens 'strong' military action as Iran protest deaths rise
events.description: Hundreds of protesters have been killed in Iran, rights groups say, as President Trump threatened "strong" military action.

events.title: Iran protests: Tehran ready for 'war and dialogue' with US
events.description: Iran has responded to threats from the US, saying it is ready for war but will also seek dialogue. Meanwhile, German Chancellor Merz has called on the regime to end the violence against its people. DW has more.

events.title: UN chief ‚Äòshocked‚Äô by reports of excessive force against protesters in Iran
events.description: The UN Secretary-General is shocked by reports of violence and excessive use of force by Iranian authorities against protesters across the country, urging restraint and the immediate restoration of communications as unrest enters its third week.

events.title: Sudan war leaves millions hungry and displaced as health system nears collapse
events.description: Sudan‚Äôs protracted conflict has spiralled into one of the world‚Äôs most severe humanitarian crises, with hunger, displacement and the collapse of basic services exacting a daily toll on civilians.

events.title: More than $230k raised in a day for hero Bondi Junction police officer after ‚Äòrare‚Äô cancer diagnosis
events.description: Amy Scott, who confronted Joel Cauchi alone during the April 2024 Westfield attack, has been diagnosed with ‚Äòaggressive‚Äô breast cancer Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Amy Scott, the New South Wales police officer who pursued and shot the perpetrator of the Bondi Junction stabbing attack, has been diagnosed with an ‚Äúaggressive form of breast cancer‚Äù. Joel Cauchi killed six people in a mass stabbing attack on 13 April 2024 at the Bondi Westfield shopping centre and wounded another 10. Continue reading...

events.title: World News in Brief: Repression in Uganda, fighting in Syria‚Äôs Aleppo continues, Gaza and West Bank updates
events.description: The UN has raised serious concerns ahead of Uganda‚Äôs elections scheduled for 15 January, warning they will take place in an environment marked by widespread repression, intimidation and shrinking civic space.

events.title: South Sudan: Increase in abductions and sexual violence ‚Äòunacceptable‚Äô
events.description: Despite reductions in the overall number of conflict-related incidents in South Sudan, a rise in abductions and sexual violence is concerning, the UN peacekeeping mission in the country, UNMISS, said on Friday.

events.title: Attempt to overturn the Gambia‚Äôs ban on FGM heard by supreme court
events.description: Case brought by Muslim leaders and MP follows failed 2024 bid and seen as part of global anti-women‚Äôs rights backlash A group of religious leaders and an MP in the Gambia have launched efforts to overturn a ban on female genital mutilation at the country‚Äôs supreme court. The court case, due to resume this month, comes after two babies bled to death after undergoing FGM in the Gambia last year. Almameh Gibba, an MP and one of the plaintiffs, tabled a bill to decriminalise FGM that was rejected by the country‚Äôs parliament in 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran protests enter third week under internet blackout
events.description: As Iran's protests enter a third week, the country's president blames foreign powers for the unrest, and warns it will retaliate if the US intervenes militarily.

events.title: Israel prepares for potential Iranian attack as tension grows with US
events.description: As tensions grow between the US and Iran over the brutal crackdown of Iranian protesters, Israel prepares for a potential attack from its neighbour. Iranian authorities have warned that in case of a US intervention, US bases in Israel could be targeted - but there is also concern they could attack 'out of fear that they could actually be losing power", says FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky from Jerusalem.

events.title: Myanmar vote a ‚Äòfacade‚Äô to entrench military rule, independent rights expert says
events.description: An independent human rights expert has urged the international community to reject the electoral process organised by Myanmar‚Äôs military government, after the first round of voting revealed widespread coercion, exclusion and violence.

events.title: World News in Brief: Fighting intensifies in Syria‚Äôs Aleppo and South Sudan‚Äôs Jonglei state, acute hunger in Niger
events.description: UN Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres continues to be gravely alarmed by escalating hostilities in Aleppo, Syria, and mounting reports of civilian casualties, his Spokesperson said on Thursday.

events.title: NASA makes 'unprecedented' call to bring astronauts home after illness, expert says: 'Evacuated from orbit'
events.description: NASA makes unprecedented decision to bring International Space Station crew home early after medical emergency ‚Äì first time in 25-year station history.

events.title: New video shows minutes leading up to deadly Minneapolis ICE shooting
events.description: New video shows moments before ICE agent fatally shot Minneapolis woman Renee Nicole Good. DHS claims footage shows she was "stalking" federal operation.

events.title: Pauline Hanson and Barnaby Joyce use Gina Rinehart‚Äôs private jet to visit flooded parts of Queensland
events.description: Joyce says the pair were saving taxpayer money and ‚ÄòI‚Äôve got no problems with that at all‚Äô Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The One Nation MPs Pauline Hanson and Barnaby Joyce have used a private jet owned by the mining magnate Gina Rinehart to tour flood-affected Queensland communities. Joyce, who defected from the Nationals last month, said the pair were saving taxpayers money by using the Gulfstream G700 plane and a helicopter at the weekend, including to meet with local mayors in North Queensland. Continue reading...

events.title: Wildfires in south Argentina rip through nearly 12,000 hectares of forest, threatening communities
events.description: Wildfires in the Argentine Patagonia have burned nearly 12,000 hectares of land, threatening a power plant, a school and rural properties

events.title: Iran‚Äôs ‚Äòdistinctive‚Äô drone deployment sees death toll soar amid violent protests
events.description: Iran allegedly deploys drones amid nationwide protests as Human Rights Activists News Agency reports at least 544 confirmed deaths and over 10,000 arrests.

events.title: Netanyahu and Rubio discuss US military intervention in Iran amid ongoing nationwide protests: report
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke as Israel goes on high alert and Iran faces mounting anti-regime protests.

events.title: Iran protests grow deadlier as regime internet blackout fails to stop uprising
events.description: Iran's anti-government protests enter day 13 with reported death toll of 51, including 9 children, as demonstrations spread nationwide against the regime.

events.title: Bride and groom killed by gas explosion day after Pakistan wedding

events.title: Los Angeles wildfire recovery enters second year as frustration and uncertainty linger
events.description: One year after massive wildfires devastated Los Angeles County, many families remain displaced, frustrated by slow rebuilding, permit delays and ongoing housing challenges.

events.title: Iran protests: Death toll rises to over 540 ‚Äî activists
events.description: Protests challenging the regime have continued in defiance of a clampdown by Iran's clerical rulers. Meanwhile, the Iranian government has declared a "national resistance march" for Monday. DW has the latest.

events.title: Fact-finding mission urges Iran to end protest violence and restore internet
events.description: The UN-mandated independent human rights fact-finding mission on Iran has urged authorities to immediately restore internet access and halt the violent crackdown of the ongoing, nationwide protest.

events.title: UN‚Äôs ‚Äòresponsibility to deliver‚Äô will not waver, after US announces withdrawal from dozens of international organizations
events.description: Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres has expressed regret over the decision by the United States to withdraw from a number of UN entities, while underscoring that the system will continue to deliver on all its mandates.

events.title: Street takeovers and traffic control by agitators in Minnesota cross legal lines, retired detective says
events.description: Retired NYPD detective warns Minnesota traffic obstruction by agitators threatens public safety as crowds impede federal law enforcement operations.

events.title: As Trump urges deal, Cuban president warns that the country will defend itself 'to the last drop of blood'
events.description: As Trump pressured Cuba to strike a deal, Cuban President Miguel D√≠az-Canel Berm√∫dez asserted that the country will defend itself "to the last drop of blood."

events.title: Nigerian stars dominate All Africa Music Awards
events.description: Global superstar Burna Boy claimed the prestigious Album of the Year award for his latest work No Sign of Weakness.

events.title: At the heart of change: Spotlight Initiative highlights breakthroughs in tackling gender-based violence
events.description: When it comes to protecting women and girls from gender-based violence, change happens when they are ‚Äúat the heart of every decision,‚Äù according to Erin Kenny, Global Coordinator of the Spotlight Initiative a United Nations‚ÄìEuropean Union partnership aimed at tackling all forms of abuse against women and girls.

events.title: US warns Americans to leave Venezuela immediately as armed militias set up roadblocks
events.description: The U.S. government issued an urgent security alert for Americans in Venezuela to leave immediately due to safety concerns and an inability to provide continued assistance.

events.title: Iranian hospitals overwhelmed with injuries as protests rage across Islamic Republic
events.description: Iranian hospitals are reportedly overwhelmed as anti-government protests rage, with doctors treating gunshot wounds to heads and eyes amid nationwide unrest.

events.title: One person dead and 300 buildings destroyed in Australia bushfires
events.description: A state of emergency has been declared in Victoria as thousands of firefighters battle the blaze.

events.title: Underground church says leaders detained as China steps up crackdown
events.description: Early Rain pastor said to be among those held in sweep that followed arrests of members of other unregistered churches Leaders of a prominent underground church have been detained in south-west China, according to a church statement, the latest blow in what appears to be a sweeping crackdown on unregistered Christian groups in the country. On Tuesday, Li Yingqiang, the leader of the Early Rain Covenant Church, was taken by police from his home in Deyang, a small city in Sichuan province, according to the statement. Li‚Äôs wife, Zhang Xinyue, has also been detained, along with two other church members: Dai Zhichao, a pastor; and Ye Fenghua, a lay member. At least a further four members were taken and later released, while some others remain out of contact. Continue reading...

events.title: Germany news: Ice warnings force closure of schools
events.description: Schools in many parts of Germany have closed their doors following warnings of extremely icy conditions. Meanwhile, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has started his first state visit to India. DW has more.

events.title: Russia strike leaves 1,000 Kyiv apartment blocks without heating
events.description: More than 1,000 apartment blocks in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv remain without power after a Russian bombardment of the country's energy system overnight.

events.title: Ukraine: Massive overnight attack leaves millions in the dark
events.description: UN agencies are supporting efforts on Friday to keep energy services up and running in Ukraine, and families warm amid freezing winter temperatures, following a large-scale overnight attack.

events.title: Expert warns of 'extreme violence' in Venezuelan mining as Trump admin eyes mineral reserves
events.description: Venezuela's illicit mining economy dominated by criminal groups involves forced labor, torture and human rights abuses, expert tells Fox News Digital.

events.title: Ex-con charged in Christmas Day CVS robbery that left clerk fatally stabbed
events.description: CVS clerk Eddy Cine Jr. volunteered to work Christmas Day shift, only to be allegedly stabbed to death by armed robber minutes before closing time.

events.title: Myanmar Rohingya genocide case begins at International Court
events.description: The UN‚Äôs top court is hearing a genocide case against Myanmar, accused of mass killings of Rohingya Muslims.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Malaysia blocks Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok AI over fake, sexualised images
events.description: Country follows Indonesia in restricting access after global outcry over X‚Äôs AI tool Malaysia has become the second country to temporarily block access to Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok after a global outcry over the AI tool and its ability to produce fake, sexualised images. Malaysia said it would restrict access to Grok until effective safeguards were implemented, a day after similar action was taken by Indonesia. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump threatens Iran as country cracks down on protesters
events.description: President Trump has threatened Iran amid a deadly crackdown on protesters. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to Holly Dagres of the Washington Institute for Near East Policy about the protests.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier
events.description: An international sports governing body is investigating after a Canadian coach was accused of manipulating an event ‚Äî depriving racers of qualifying points ahead of February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.description: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success ‚Äî or failure ‚Äî at previous World Cups.

events.title: Cuba's Diaz-Canel says there are no current talks with US after Trump threats
events.description: Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel said that there were no ongoing discussions between Havana and Washington after US President Donald Trump claimed to be "talking to Cuba". Trump had earlier warned the Cuban government to "make a deal' before it was "too late", having pledged to cut off all Venezuelan oil or money going to the Caribbean nation.

events.title: 'International influence' over 2026 edition of the Golden Globes
events.description: ‚ÄúOne Battle After Another,‚Äù which topped the list of nominations with nine, took best motion picture, musical or comedy, and ‚ÄúHamnet‚Äù won the title of best motion picture, drama. The ceremony sets up a new battle for the Oscars in March, with quite an international influence. FRANCE 24's Emma Jones tells us more.

events.title: What the US withdrawal from UN bodies could mean for climate, trade and development
events.description: The United States‚Äô intention to withdraw from a host of UN bodies announced this week targets programmes and initiatives focusing on a wide range of crucial areas, including the climate crisis, trade, gender and development.

events.title: Sudan's government returns to capital after nearly 3 years of war
events.description: The military-backed government is back in Khartoum after being driven out by its paramilitary rival.

events.title: Writers declare solidarity with prisoners on hunger strike for Palestine
events.description: Global writers and scholars have shown their support to hunger striking prisoners from the Palestine Action group.

events.title: Cuba defiant in face of 'criminal' US threats
events.description: After abducting the leader of Venezuela, the US is now threatening Cuba. Havana says Washington's behavior is a threat to global peace as President Trump jokes about appointing Marco Rubio president of the island nation.

events.title: Five human heads found hanging at picturesque beach
events.description: Five human heads were found hanging from ropes at a beach in Ecuador as the country suffers a wave of violence related to drug trafficking.

events.title: Five severed heads found hanging on Ecuador beach amid escalating gang clashes

events.title: Trump mulls 'very strong' military options as hundreds killed in Iran protests
events.description: The US president says Iranian leaders have called "to negotiate", but adds the US "may have to act" before a meeting.

events.title: Referee and student among hundreds killed in Iran protests
events.description: More than 500 people have been killed during anti-government protests, a US-based human rights group says.

events.title: What we know about the protests sweeping Iran
events.description: Crackdown on protests in Iran has resulted in multiple deaths and an internet blackout.

events.title: Israeli quadcopter kills three in Gaza‚Äôs Khan Younis; police chief slain
events.description: Despite a ceasefire that began on October 10, the Israeli army continues daily attacks on the enclave.

events.title: Truck drives into crowd at Iran protest in LA
events.description: One person was injured and a man arrested after a vehicle drove into a crowd of Iranian protesters in Los Angeles on Sunday, authorities have said.

events.title: LA protesters swarm U-Haul truck that drove through anti-Iranian regime gathering
events.description: Video shows anti-Iranian regime protesters swarming U-Haul that drove through Los Angeles demonstration, smashing windshield before police detain driver.

events.title: U-Haul truck drives through Iran protest crowd in Los Angeles, one person struck and driver detained
events.description: U-Haul truck reportedly drives through Iran protest crowd in Los Angeles, striking one person near Federal Building in Westwood. Driver detained by LAPD.

events.title: Russia fires new hypersonic missile in massive Ukraine attack, Kremlin says
events.description: Russia fired a hypersonic Oreshnik missile at Ukraine in retaliation for an alleged attack on one of Putin's residences that the U.S. and Ukraine have denied.

events.title: Syrians in Kurdish areas of Aleppo pick up pieces after clashes
events.description: The battles in Aleppo between Syrian forces, who have reasserted control, and the SDF killed many, displaced thousands.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Anger in Papua New Guinea after Starlink ordered to shut down internet services
events.description: In mid-December PNG said the company did not have a licence to operate in the country and ordered it to halt operations Frustration is growing in Papua New Guinea weeks after the government ordered Starlink to shut down operations in the country as businesses, health providers and communities struggle without access to internet services. Starlink, owned by Elon Musk‚Äôs SpaceX, is a satellite internet company that provides internet to remote places. In mid-December, the National Information and Communications Technology Authority (Nicta) ordered the company to halt operations because it was not licensed in PNG. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela begins releasing political prisoners, but hundreds remain behind bars
events.description: Venezuela has freed a handful of detainees in what it calls a gesture of national unity. Rights groups say releases are slow and the country's repressive system remains in place.

events.title: Andorra: Skier films being caught in Avalanche
events.description: Ares Masip, who knows the area well, shared her experience on social media to warn her followers about the dangers of off-piste skiing.

events.title: More federal agents to be sent to Minnesota, Trump administration says
events.description: The move comes after protests against immigration enforcement have been held across the US after a woman was shot by an ICE agent.

events.title: Trump threatens to block ExxonMobil from Venezuela after CEO calls country ‚Äòuninvestable‚Äô
events.description: US president says company is ‚Äòplaying too cute‚Äô after CEO responds sceptically to his push for oil investment after deposing Nicol√°s Maduro Donald Trump has said he might block ExxonMobil from investing in Venezuela after the oil company‚Äôs chief executive called the country ‚Äúuninvestable‚Äù during a White House meeting last week. Darren Woods told the US president that Venezuela would need to change its laws before it could be an attractive investment opportunity, during the high-profile meeting on Friday with at least 17 other oil executives. Continue reading...

events.title: Exiled crown prince Pahlavi cheers Iran protests from US
events.description: The son of Iran's last shah is positioning himself as a voice of transition as protests continue across the country. But Reza Pahlavi's role in a democratic Iran remains to be seen.

events.title: Islamic regime ideology not compatible with Iranians yearning for political, economic freedom
events.description: Iran's leaders are facing nationwide demonstrations that evolved ‚Äãfrom complaints about dire economic hardships to defiant calls for the fall of the Islamic regime. For in-depth insight and analysis, Genie Godula welcomes Iran specialist Sina AZODI, Author and Director of the Middle East Studies Program at George Washington University. As anti-government protests rage into their third week, amid internal dissent and foreign pressure, the regime's crackdown is intensifying: A nation caught between an authoritarian legacy and a restless population yearning for change.

events.title: Seattle order to stop drug arrests ‚Äòcreating havoc‚Äô for people fending off addicts surviving on theft: expert
events.description: Seattle's new drug enforcement approach sparks debate as police and advocates warn of rising crime and open-air drug markets returning to streets.

events.title: Five decapitated heads displayed on Ecuador beach
events.description: Bathers found the body parts in Puerto L√≥pez, a town which has been wracked by gang violence.

events.title: Israel advances ‚Äòfatal‚Äô settlement plan for occupied East Jerusalem
events.description: Israel‚Äôs plan for 9,000 units at Jerusalem airport is a move to sever the city from the West Bank, analyst says.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer Fran√ßois Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world‚Äôs oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: US frackers were already facing a global oil supply glut. Trump‚Äôs Venezuelan dream could make it worse
events.description: Picture is as murky as a barrel of oil, with US companies in 2026 expecting their first production drop in four years US shale-oil producers were already contending with oil prices at four-year lows. News that they may soon face a significant competitor in their back yard likely wasn‚Äôt how frackers wanted to greet 2026. The US capture of Venezuelan president Nicola√° Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, hit the share prices of independent shale-oil producers, such as Diamondback Energy and Devon Energy, last week. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump tells Cuba to ‚Äòmake a deal‚Äô or face the consequences
events.description: No more Venezuelan oil or money will flow to the communist-run island after Maduro‚Äôs fall, says US president Donald Trump has told Cuba to ‚Äúmake a deal‚Äù or face unspecified consequences, adding that no more Venezuelan oil or money would flow to the communist-run Caribbean island that has been a US foe for decades. As Cuba, a close ally of Venezuela and big beneficiary of its oil, braced for potential widespread unrest after Nicol√°s Maduro was deposed as the South American nation‚Äôs leader, the US president ramped up his threatening language on Sunday. Continue reading...

events.title: Alleged scam kingpin Chen Zhi arrives in China after extradition from Cambodia
events.description: Chen founded multinational conglomerate Prince Group that US says is front for multibillion-dollar fraud operation Chinese television has shown footage of the US-indicted tycoon Chen Zhi being escorted by armed police after his extradition to China from Cambodia, where authorities on Thursday ordered the liquidation of a bank he founded linked to a massive ‚Äúscam centre‚Äù network. Chen, who chairs a conglomerate the US says is a front for a multibillion-dollar online fraud operation, was shown in handcuffs and hooded as he was led off a plane at a Beijing airport by black-clad Swat officers, with the state broadcaster CCTV describing him as the ‚Äúleader of a major transnational gambling and fraud crime syndicate‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: Powell says US Fed subpoenaed by Trump's justice department
events.description: US Fed's Jerome Powell has alleged that President Donald Trump is using the threat of criminal indictment to influence monetary policy. Trump has denied any knowledge of the investigation.

events.title: French government faces no-confidence motions despite Mercosur opposition
events.description: The French government is facing two new no-confidence motions, after the EU gave the go-ahead on January 9 to the huge Mercosur trade pact with South America -- to the dismay of French farmers, who have been protesting for months. The new threat to the government from the far right and left's motions comes despite the fact that it led opposition to the deal. Prime minister Sebastien Lecornu denounced them as "cynical partisan posturing".

events.title: 'This is journalism at its most raw': Go behind the scenes on the frontline with new-look Sky News show
events.description: A new-look Sky News series takes viewers straight into some of the world's most hostile environments.

events.title: US military strikes Islamic State group targets in Syria, officials say
events.description: US President Donald Trump ordered the "large-scale strikes" on Saturday, US Central Command announced.

events.title: AFCON 2025 organisers investigate clashes at Nigeria, Morocco games
events.description: Organisers warn of disciplinary action against players, team officials and journalists if found guilty of wrongdoing.

events.title: How the rich are fuelling the climate crisis for everyone else
events.description: Billionaires own assets that emit more carbon in minutes than others do in lifetimes. The poor pay the cost.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie accuses Lagos hospital of negligence after son‚Äôs death
events.description: Lawyers for Adichie and her husband serve Euracare hospital with legal notice after death of 21-month-old The Nigerian author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie has accused a Lagos hospital of negligence after the death of one of her 21-month-old twin boys. Nkanu Nnamdi died on 6 January after a brief illness. He was one of twin boys born to Adichie and Ivara Esege, a doctor, in 2024 by surrogacy, eight years after the birth of their first child, a girl. Continue reading...

events.title: European firms hit hiring brakes over AI and slowing growth
events.description: COVID-19 flipped workplace power toward employees as remote work became the norm. Today, with Europe's industrial slowdown and AI automation, workers are growing increasingly wary of switching jobs.

events.title: Oscar predictions are on as voting for awards starts
events.description: The Golden Globes crowned One Battle After Another and Hamnet as best films in their categories, Timothee Chalamet and Jessie Buckley as best actor and actress. And now, the bets are on for the Oscars, held in March. With the Golden Globes are a predictor for Hollywood's most prestigious awards ceremony, FRANCE 24's Emma Jones takes a look at who the favourites are.

events.title: What is Starlink, the satellite service Iranians use to post about the protests?
events.description: Elon's Musk Starlink Satellite service is being used by Iran's protest movement to bypass the regime's internet ban. Although recent reports show that Iranian authorities have been able to block the service locally in some instances. Initially Space X funded the service, but the US Department of Defence later took over the payments. Donald Trump has implied the Washington could do the same in Iran.

events.title: 'One Battle After Another' and 'Hamnet' win top Golden Globe awards
events.description: Awards season is underway in Hollywood with the Golden Globes taking place in Los Angeles overnight. One Battle After Another won in the best comedy film category, but its male lead didn't take bag the award in the best actor category. It was instead given to Timothee Chalamet for his role in Marty Supreme. In the meantime, 'Hamnet' won best film in drama.

events.title: Driverless robotaxis arrive in US cities, but are they safe?
events.description: In the United States, driverless taxis piloted by artificial intelligence are appearing in cities from Los Angeles to Miami. But are these phantom drivers more or less prone to accidents than humans? Do robotaxis pose risks to our safety? Our France 2 colleagues went for a test drive.

events.title: British skier killed in avalanche in French Alps
events.description: A British skier has died in an avalanche in the French Alps.

events.title: Roadside bomb targeting police vehicle kills 6 officers in northwest Pakistan
events.description: Police say a roadside bomb targeting a police vehicle has killed six officers in northwestern Pakistan near the Afghan border

events.title: Syria signals renewed cooperation on chemical weapons destruction
events.description: Progress continues to be made towards eliminating remnants of the chemical weapons programme in Syria that was developed under the Assad regime, the UN Security Council heard on Thursday.

events.title: Ex-husband charged in Ohio dentist double murder to appear in Illinois court for possible extradition
events.description: Ohio dentist's wife and husband allegedly killed by her ex-husband, a vascular surgeon now facing extradition from Illinois. Double murder shocks Columbus.

events.title: Why political assassination cases aren't automatically death penalty eligible
events.description: Prosecutors struggle with charging alleged assassins Luigi Mangione and Tyler Robinson as U.S. law lacks clear penalties for political murders and assassinations.

events.title: Critical clue led police to suspect Chicago doctor in deaths of Ohio dentist, wife
events.description: Chicago doctor arrested in Ohio double murder case after surveillance footage allegedly shows his car at victims' home during the time of killings.

events.title: Mississippi synagogue burned in arson attack, suspect in custody
events.description: Suspect arrested after apparent arson destroys sacred Torahs at Mississippi's largest synagogue. FBI investigating the blaze at Beth Israel Congregation.

events.title: Nobel Institute shuts down talk of Venezuelan leader sharing Peace Prize with Trump
events.description: Nobel Institute rejects suggestion from Venezuelan leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado to transfer her Peace Prize to Trump, stating awards "cannot be transferred."

events.title: Trump discusses whether he'd order a mission to capture Putin
events.description: President Donald Trump dismisses the idea of capturing Vladimir Putin, saying he's "disappointed" the Russia-Ukraine war remains without a resolution.

events.title: Socialist dictator Maduro gone, but Venezuelans remain wary after years of oppression
events.description: Venezuelan citizens express cautious relief after Nicolas Maduro was ousted and taken to New York to face trial, ending years of controversial socialist rule.

events.title: Custody extended for owner of Swiss ski bar after deadly fire
events.description: Jacques Moretti is being held as a potential flight risk, Swiss media reports say.

events.title: Protester scales Iranian Embassy in London, tears down regime flag, hoists pre-revolution symbol
events.description: Drama played out in London when a protester reportedly scaled Iran's embassy building, tears down a regime flag and replaces it with a pre-1979 flag.

events.title: Which countries host the largest Venezuelan populations?
events.description: About 8 million Venezuelans, or a quarter of the population, have fled their country in recent years.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Indonesia blocks Musk‚Äôs Grok chatbot due to risk of pornographic content
events.description: Move comes after governments and regulators from Europe to Asia have condemned the AI tool and some have opened inquiries into sexualised content Indonesia temporarily blocked Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok chatbot on Saturday due to the risk of AI-generated pornographic content, becoming the first country to deny access to the AI tool. The move comes after governments, researchers and regulators from Europe to Asia have condemned and some have opened inquiries into sexualised content on the app. Continue reading...

events.title: Historic upset in English soccer's FA Cup as Macclesfield beat holders Crystal Palace
events.description: The result marks the first time in 117 years that a side from outside the major national leagues has eliminated the reigning FA Cup holders.

events.title: Venezuela's exiles in Chile caught between hope and uncertainty
events.description: Initial joy among Venezuela's diaspora in Chile has given way to caution, as questions grow over what Maduro's capture means for the country ‚Äî and for those who fled it.

events.title: Key French budget talks to resume as government faces two no-confidence motions
events.description: Crucial talks regarding the 2026 budget are set to resume in the French National Assembly on January 13. A few days earlier, a parliamentary committee rejected the budget bill in its present form, another sign of the uphill struggle the government is facing to secure it. The Prime minister even hinted at the possibility of a snap election in a few months. FRANCE 24's Marc Perelman breaks it down for us.

events.title: 'Settling scores': Israel revokes French historian's travel permit
events.description: French historian Vincent Lemire, who specialises in the history of Israel and the occupied Palestinian territories, has been banned from travelling to Israel for criticising the country's deadly campaign in Gaza, the academic said Monday. Lemire previously worked as the head of the French Research Centre in Jerusalem.

events.title: Japan will host summit with S. Korea to bolster ties as relations with Beijing worsen
events.description: Japan‚Äôs Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi will host a summit with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung on Tuesday to ensure stable and friendly ties as her country faces growing tension with Beijing

events.title: Nepalese royalists demand monarchy restoration ahead of March elections
events.description: Supporters of Nepal‚Äôs deposed royal family have rallied in the capital to demand the monarchy's restoration ahead of March elections

events.title: Built on care and connection: How one Somali-British woman is strengthening diaspora communities
events.description: When her family moved from Somalia to London in the 1980s, Safia Jama watched women in her community help her mother navigate a new life in the UK ‚Äî booking doctor‚Äôs appointments, enrolling children in school, and learning how to access everyday services in a new country.

events.title: Wild video shows federal agents detaining 2 men at Minnesota gas station as agitators gather
events.description: Dramatic video shows two men being taken into custody by federal agents at a Minnesota gas station. One man was drug out of his car and thrown to the ground.

events.title: DEA zeroes in on Cartel of the Suns bosses as Maduro is hauled into US narco case
events.description: Nicolas Maduro arrested on federal narcotics trafficking charges as Venezuelan President allegedly led "Cartel of the Suns" cocaine network, prosecutors say.

events.title: Fed chair Powell hits out at 'unprecedented' probe by US justice department
events.description: Jerome Powell said he believed the investigation was due to Donald Trump's anger over the Fed's refusal to cut interest rates.

events.title: Los Angeles police arrest man who drove through Iran protesters
events.description: LAPD say they are looking into ‚Äúassault with a deadly weapon‚Äù charges after a drove truck through Iran protesters.

events.title: Syrian forces search for explosives, weapons after SDF pulls out of Aleppo
events.description: Residents start returning to areas previously controlled by SDF fighters after their withdrawal from the city.

events.title: Germany and Iran: Merz calls Tehran leadership 'weak'
events.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has dubbed Iran's suppression of protests as 'brutal and disproportionate.' A government spokesperson in Berlin backed taking one step at a time, but many in Germany want faster action.

events.title: Swiss court orders Crans-Montana bar owner held in preventive custody after deadly fire
events.description: A Swiss ‚Äãcourt on ‚Å†Monday ordered the co-owner ‚Äãof a ‚Äçbar in the ‚Äãski resort of Crans-Montana ‚Äãthat caught fire on New Year‚Äôs Day to be held in preventive detention for three months. Jacques Moretti was taken into custody after being interviewed by prosecutors on Friday.

events.title: Greenland welcomes all to explore its lands, while honouring its traditions and values
events.description: European powers, including Greenland, are pushing back against what many see as threatening rhetoric and predatory conduct from Donald Trump who seeks to forcibly annex the autonomous territory within the Kingdom of Denmark. As the unprecedented standoff becomes a diplomatic flashpoint within NATO and across Europe, Casper Frank M√∏ller, CEO/Co-founder of Roar Arctic in Greenland, offers rare insight into how Greenlanders are navigating the deeper undercurrents of identity, sovereignty, the economy and cultural preservation.

events.title: Cuba's president says no current talks with the US after Trump threatens it
events.description: Cuban President Miguel D√≠az-Canel says his administration is currently not in talks with the U.S. government

events.title: First responders enter devastated Aleppo neighborhood after days of deadly fighting
events.description: Residents have started returning to a contested neighborhood in Syria's Aleppo after deadly clashes between government and Kurdish-led forces

events.title: Ukraine: New strikes disrupt basic services for millions
events.description: Several parts of Ukraine were hit by a new wave of Russian strikes between Wednesday and Thursday morning.

events.title: Smithsonian replaces Trump portrait display, strips Jan 6 and impeachment references from accompanying text
events.description: Smithsonian replaces Trump portrait, removes impeachment text after president calls museums "woke" and threatens funding cuts in sweeping review.

events.title: Washington anti-ICE agitators clash with crowd calling for Iran regime change
events.description: A convoluted protest clash unfolded in D.C. on Sunday. Anti-ICE agitators shouted at Iranian regime change protesters as others shouted "Free Palestine" and "No kings."

events.title: US hostages in Iran face heightened risk as protests spread, experts say number held may exceed estimates
events.description: Iran's systematic hostage-taking policy targets American citizens as political leverage, with experts calling for automatic sanctions and consequences to combat the regime's strategy.

events.title: Exiled Iranian crown prince urges Trump to help as protests against Islamic regime intensify: 'Man of peace'
events.description: Exiled Iranian Crown Prince Pahlavi appeals to President Donald Trump for immediate intervention as Iran implements internet blackout amid deadly protests.

events.title: Yemen‚Äôs Saudi-backed government retakes southern areas from STC: What next?
events.description: PLC takes control of southern Yemen, but challenges for a united Yemen remain amid Houthi control of Sanaa.

events.title: Sudan‚Äôs army renewing military effort to retake Kordofan, Darfur from RSF
events.description: Mission against the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces would surpass army's recapture of Khartoum state last year.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Australia should reconsider alliance with ‚Äòfiercely unpredictable‚Äô US, former foreign ministers say
events.description: Bob Carr says Trump foreign policy presents a ‚Äòcolossal challenge‚Äô for Australia and Gareth Evans says the Aukus pact should be reconsidered Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Albanese government should urgently reconsider Australia‚Äôs alliance with the United States, two former Labor foreign ministers have said, as they voiced alarm over Donald Trump‚Äôs military intervention in Venezuela and renewed push to claim Greenland. Speaking to Guardian Australia in the days after the US seizure of Venezuela‚Äôs president, Nicol√°s Maduro, former Labor foreign minister Bob Carr said Trump‚Äôs America had become a ‚Äúfiercely unpredictable‚Äù ally, raising a ‚Äúcolossal challenge‚Äù for Australia. Continue reading...

events.title: In Zambia, Great Lakes defense chiefs talk DRC insecurity
events.description: Over the weekend, regional defense ministers met in Livingstone to address the worsening security situation in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. However, an end to the fighting is not in sight.

events.title: German Chancellor Merz begins his first state visit to India
events.description: Merz met Indian Prime Minister Modi with with defense sales and trade ties high on the agenda. The visit comes just weeks ahead of plans to sign a long-awaited free trade agreement between India and the EU. DW has more.

events.title: China says US shouldn't use other countries as 'pretext' to pursue its interests
events.description: China says the United States shouldn't use other countries as a pretext to pursue its interests in Greenland

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Ros√© used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Xinjiang whistleblower faces deportation to China ‚Äî lawyer
events.description: After documenting Xinjiang's Uyghur detention network, a Chinese dissident faces deportation to China, his lawyer says. His case highlights the clash between US immigration policy and human rights concerns.

events.title: ‚ÄòBeyond GDP‚Äô economists push for clearer metrics on wellbeing, sustainability
events.description: Top finance experts are meeting at UN Geneva this week to push for a radical shake up in the way economic growth is gauged, in response to concerns that GDP measurements provide little insight about progress on key sustainability targets that are vital to our survival.

events.title: Who would rule Iran if the Islamic Republic falls?
events.description: From Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi to imprisoned activists, Iran's potential successors remain unclear. Opposition figures debate who could unify after regime change.

events.title: UAE cuts funding for citizens studying at UK universities over campus radicalization fears: report
events.description: The UAE is pulling scholarships from U.K. universities, citing fears Emirati students could be radicalized amid tensions over Britain and the Muslim Brotherhood.

events.title: Monkeys on the loose in St Louis after four-day search
events.description: Local officials said they do not know where the exotic animals came from or how many are at large.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Frightening ordeal as Sky News team forced into cars and camera seized - with dissent in China rising dramatically
events.description: In an industrial corner of the city of Shenzhen, there was a sense the system was bracing.

events.title: India and Germany sign deals to deepen economic and security ties
events.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and German Chancellor Friedrich Merz met on Monday in the Indian city of Gandhinagar to strengthen economic and security ties

events.title: Chalamet beats DiCaprio to Golden Globes glory
events.description: The Marty Supreme star is among the big winners at the Globes and gets a boost in his quest for an Oscar.

events.title: Jailed Venezuelan politician's son says Trump shouldn't be 'fooled' by pledge of prisoner releases
events.description: Ram√≥n Guanipa's father was accused of treason for challenging the disputed 2024 presidential election result.

events.title: Meta blocks 550,000 accounts under Australia's social media ban
events.description: The new law, which came into effect in December, is aimed at protecting children from online harm.

events.title: Thousands of tourists stranded in Lapland as cold grounds flights
events.description: All flights out of Kittila airport in northern Finland were cancelled on Sunday with temperatures falling as low as -38C.

events.title: Hungary grants asylum to Polish ex-justice minister
events.description: Granting asylum to a citizen of a fellow EU member goes against the spirit of EU standards.

events.title: Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal, before it is too late'
events.description: Trump has been turning his attention to Cuba since US forces seized Venezuelan leader Nicol√°s Maduro.

events.title: Ai, Japanese chimpanzee who counted and painted, dies at 49
events.description: Ai's cognitive abilities had been studied extensively since she was brought to a Japanese institute in 1977.

events.title: Bob Weir, Grateful Dead co-founder, dies aged 78
events.description: Weir was a fixture in the psychedelic rock group and its various spin-offs over 60 years.

events.title: Venezuela says over 100 political prisoners released; pope meets Machado
events.description: Penitentiary Services Ministry says those freed had been 'deprived of their liberty' for disruptive acts.

events.title: Egypt vs Senegal: AFCON semifinal ‚Äì team news, start time and lineups
events.description: Pre-tournament favourites Senegal face AFCON's most successful team in Wednesday's eagerly awaited first semifinal.

events.title: Why is Bosnia sending troops to Gaza?
events.description: Bosnians overwhelmingly support Palestine. And yet their elite want to help legitimise a 'peace' plan favouring Israel.

events.title: Are we overestimating the value of AI?
events.description: Billions are being poured into advancing AI, despite big losses. Is an AI bubble forming, and what happens if it bursts?

events.title: Displaced citizens without a vote Myanmar‚Äôs election
events.description: Many of the millions of people displaced by fighting in Myanmar won‚Äôt vote in elections held by a military government.

events.title: Which are Iran‚Äôs main opposition groups?
events.description: Iran's fragmented opposition includes figures living abroad, such as Reza Pahlavi, the heir of the former monarch.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship ‚Äî and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news

events.title: Malaysia, Indonesia become first to block Musk's Grok over AI deepfakes
events.description: Malaysia and Indonesia have become the first countries to block Grok, the artificial intelligence chatbot developed by Elon Musk's xAI, after authorities said it was being misused to generate sexually explicit and non-consensual images.

events.title: Latin American left responds to Trump's pledge to take over of Venezuelan oil
events.description: Latin America's left is in disarray after the seizure of Nicolas Maduro and the U.S.'s pledge to take over Venezuela's oil industry. Many on the left are changing their rhetoric about President Trump.

events.title: Myanmar faces Rohingya genocide case: What to know
events.description: A landmark case accusing Myanmar of committing genocide against minority Muslim Rohingya has opened at the United Nations' top court. The outcome will have repercussions beyond the Southeast Asian nation.

events.title: Croatia reintroduces conscription after almost two decades
events.description: Croatia is bringing back compulsory military service for young men for the first time since 2008. What‚Äôs behind the shift ‚Äî and could it signal a wider return of conscription in the Balkans?

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.description: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: Malaysia, Indonesia block Grok AI bot over explicit images
events.description: The move comes after the bot was found to be generating explicit images of women and children, without consent, on Elon Musk's X.

events.title: Meta shuts over 544,000 Australian accounts after ban
events.description: The tech giant removed Facebook, Instagram and Threads accounts to comply with Australia's social media ban for under-16-year-olds.

events.title: Menopause: When hormones harm the economy
events.description: There are nine million working women in Germany of menopausal age. When they experience symptoms, it has economic consequences. There are, however, things companies can do to retain their personnel.

events.title: Jowee Omicil celebrates Haiti and Miles Davis on 'sMiLes'
events.description: In this edition of our arts24 music show, Jennifer Ben Brahim chats with musical polymath Jowee BasH! Omicil. The Haitian-Canadian artist blends jazz with Creole traditions, gospel, hip-hop and voodoo rhythms. He's worked with the likes of Andr√© 3000, Tony Allen and Ibrahim Maalouf. He's just released his 11th album "sMiLes", a manifesto celebrating personal expression and the courage to take risks.

events.title: Trump 'open' to meeting with Venezuelan interim leader a week after capture
events.description: On January 11, Donald Trump said his administration was working well with Venezuelan interim leader Delcy Rodriguez and that he would be open to meeting with her, in a small respite since the capture of Maduro. But for many Venezuelans FRANCE 24's James Andre spoke to on the border with Colombia, the expected change away from Maduro's regime has yet to come. He tells us more from his time at the border with Colombia.

events.title: UK probes Elon Musk's X over 'disgusting' sexualised AI images created by Grok
events.description: The UK's media regulator Ofcom launched a probe into X on Monday after its AI chatbot Grok was used to generate sexualised images of children and deepfakes. Prime Minister Keir Starmer has urged X‚Äôs owner Elon Musk ‚Äúto get a grip‚Äù on Grok, describing the images as ‚Äúdisgusting‚Äù.

events.title: Trump wants a deal but insists US will acquire Greenland 'one way or the other'
events.description: Donald Trump has said he wants to make a deal with Greenland and won't let Russia or China take control of the Arctic territory.

events.title: Myanmar accused of genocide against Rohingya minority in landmark UN case
events.description: Myanmar stands accused of committing genocide against members of the Rohingya ethnic minority in a case opening at a United Nations court this week.

events.title: How Iran enforced internet blackout - and the attempts to overcome it
events.description: Iran's communication blackout is different to what we've seen before - but could Elon Musk help to bypass it?

events.title: -37C temperatures traps thousands of tourists in Finland
events.description: Thousands of tourists have been left stranded in northern Finland after flights at Kittila Airport were cancelled due to severe cold.

events.title: Pope Leo XIV meets with Venezuelan opposition leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has met with Venezuelan opposition leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado at the Vatican

events.title: New US ambassador to India pushes for deeper trade ties despite  oil tensions
events.description: The U.S. and India are actively working on a bilateral trade agreement to strengthen their economic and strategic partnership

events.title: UN court to begin hearings on whether Myanmar committed genocide against the Rohingya
events.description: Myanmar heard accusations that it is responsible for genocide against the Rohingya ethnic minority at the top court of the United Nations, as long-awaited hearings began on Monday

events.title: Off the ballot, Ugandan president's son waits in the wings this election

events.title: Britain is in talks with NATO to counter Russia and China in the Arctic

How can I live in Afghanistan?‚Äù The words of Sumaiya, who staffs a helpline for refugees and asylum-seekers living in Pakistan but facing the eventuality of having to return to neighbouring Afghanistan.

events.title: Aid continues despite winter hardship in Gaza and West Bank, UN says
events.description: Despite harsh winter conditions and continuing access constraints, the UN and partners are maintaining large-scale humanitarian operations in Gaza and the occupied West Bank, with a focus on shelter, water, health and education.
